passages.text: Best Buy Co., Inc.  BBY | \(75.45  In Line | Target Price/Base Case:\) 75.00  Company Update

Best Buy's global 2Q comp of \(+1.6\%\) came in well above the street's \(- 0.5\%\) , while adj. EPS of \(\) 1.28\(beat by 7 cents. BBY's best comp since 3Q21 was driven by the Switch launch. While margins were pressured by mix, BBY guided 3Q comps to "similar" to 2Q's \(+1.6\%\) , above consensus estimates of flat comps, while also guiding adj. operating margin to \(- 3.7\%\) which is more in line with Street expectations of \(3.7\%\) . Despite the 2Q strength and momentum into 3Q, Best Buy maintained their full year guide citing uncertainty related to tariffs. They did note that sales growth momentum has continued into August. On 2Q, the strength was driven by gaming (Switch launch), computing, and mobile phones. Gross margins down 30bps reflects mix into lower margin sales partially offset by improvement within services. U.S comp came in at \(+1.1\%\) while International was strong at \(+7.6\%\) . Weakness continued in Appliances down \(8.5\%\) while consumer electronics came in \(- 4.9\%\) . Entertainment the strongest reporting \(37.5\%\) comps. For the full year, the street is currently sitting at the low end of the\) 6.15- \$6.30 EPS guide. The 2Q beat and top line momentum into 3Q likely moves the Street into the upper range of their guide, with tariff impacts and consumer price elasticity responses remaining key areas of uncertainty. Inventories were up \(2\%\) , suggesting a relatively clean position. Questions for the call are sustainability of strength without Switch, gross margins puts and takes, AUR, inflation, traffic, service revenues/margins and any consumer trade down and shift in credit trends. Call is at 8am.

2Q Details: Adjusted 2Q EPS of \(\) 1.28\$ beat consensus estimates of \(\) 1.21\(. Enterprise comps increased \(+1.6\%\) y/y, with U.S. comps positive at \(+1.1\%\) , better than expectations of \(- 0.5\%\) estimate. Domestic gross margin decreased 10- 15bps, driven by mix into lower margin categories somewhat offset by improved financial performance from the services category. Domestic SG&A was \(19.3\%\) of sales, roughly in line with last year reflecting strong cost control. Domestic operating profit margin of \(4\%\) came in down 20 bps y/y. International operating profit margin fell 20bps y/y (driven by GM declines). Total co. EBIT margin of \(3.9\%\) was better than expectations reflecting top line strength.

2Q category highlights: Domestically, Computer & mobile phones ( \(45\%\) of sales) increased \(3.8\%\) , Consumer Electronic comps decreased \(4.9\%\) in 2Q, and accounted for \(27\%\) of total sales, while Appliances ( \(12\%\) of sales) decreased \(- 8.5\%\) . Entertainment ( \(8\%\) of sales) increased an eye- popping \(37.5\%\) . Services ( \(7\%\) of sales) comped down \(1\%\) . Internationally, Computing & Mobile Phones increased \(9.5\%\) and CE grew \(1.3\%\) . Appliances were down \(5.7\%\) , Entertainment was up \(57.3\%\) and Services were up \(2.2\%\) .

Cash Flow and Balance Sheet: Inventories were up \(2\%\) y/y suggesting a clean position. Capex of \(\) 175\mathrm{mn}\$ was \(1.9\%\) of sales and mgmt. Maintained capex guidance of \(\) 700\mathrm{mn}\$ this year. BBY bought back \(\) 65\mathrm{mn}\$ of stock in 2Q. FCF in 2Q was \(\) 575\mathrm{mn}\$ , up \(20\%\) y/y.
Call is at 8AM eastern

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:
Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
In- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.

Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances.

Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
